duties_responsibilities.duty: Establish an integrated and collaborative relationship with first, second and third line of defense partners from business areas, ERM, Compliance and Audit to ensure continued compliance with ERM requirements.
Utilize insight into financial markets and industry practices to understand and navigate interdependencies of the various business models within the business area and the client organization.
Maintain working understanding of process modeling, internal control systems, risk management and compliance practices.
Approve and present reports of findings and recommendations to management.
Assess the cause of gaps to understand risk drivers, themes, trends and where similar exposures may exist in other areas of the business.
Support the identification of control gaps and assist first line management in creating and documenting necessary remediation steps.
Communicate new or revised policies, procedures, processes and related documents to appropriate team members and/or business units.
Ensure that required evidence and documentation is maintained within the system of record.

education_certification.credential: University (Degree) is preferred. 5+ Years of work experience is required; 7+ Years is preferred.
